divs: sighting details(reporting this for witness who doesn't have internet access) was taking nightly neighborhood walk when he noticed four obol drifting in the nw sky. one of the lights stopped, then added lights (4) in a semi-circle pattern around the main light. after several seconds, the semi-circled lights sequentially winked out l to r. this pattern of one light becoming four lights, then winking out one by one regenerated at least 14 or 15 times, putting on quite a show. watched them during the entire one hour walk; figured others had to be seeing them as well. there were at least three, maybe four main lights which would become groups of smaller lights, sometimes alone, sometimes simultaneously w\other lights. they generally moved from the n to sw over northern kokomo - it appeared at least one flew right over bonnaire school. there was no noise, and nothing conventional made sense. they were not flares from aircraft at nearby grissom afb, either. the lights wouldn't fade out - they were either on, or off, like someone flipping a switch. all the lights, even the smaller ones in the semicircle patterns, were of an orangish color. by the time the walk ended and the witness entered his home, the lights were nearly gone from his view. he came back outside a few minutes later to take out the trash, and the lights were completely gone, after putting on a show which lasted an hour. witness is a mufon menber, but has not seen any aerial phenomenon in many years. don't have any idea what the lights were, but pretty sure they were not conventional aircraft, or flares dropped by aircraft.
trends: There have been 61 other sightings in Kokomo
There were 2 other sightings in Kokomo on or around March 6th 2008
